newsitem.title: USA: Software Spectrum said Jan sales weak.
newsitem.headline: Software Spectrum said Jan sales weak.

text.p: Software Spectrum Inc said sales in February and March are not expected to fully compensate for the low level of sales seen in January.
Software Spectrum said its sales in January 1997 were "characteristically weak," following high spending by corporate customers in December.

"Sales in February and March 1997 improved over January, yet at this time the increased volume is not expected to fully compensate for the low level of January sales, when evaluated on the basis of expected sales for the calendar quarter," the company said in a prepared statement.
Shares of Software Spectrum, a national reseller of microcomputer business software, fell 4-1/8 to 16.
